answer.para:
Glad you asked ;) Ian Molton in the UK runs a Quake server for LFS users. Here are details:
Players need the latest Quake 3 release. As of February, 2003, this is 1.32b from
Players need the pak0.pk3 file from the full game of Quake 3. This is available on the Quake 3 CD (even the MS Windows version). It goes in /usr/local/games/quake3/baseq3/ unless you installed Quake 3 somewhere else.
Players need the add on maps used in the server which they can get from and install in ~/.q3a/baseq3/ or where ever the pak0.pk3 file is. Downloading the maps manually is absolutely necessary because the server has automatic map downloading disabled.
For the same reason that automatic map downloading is disabled, please don't download from the web while a game is in progress.
Although the server is only guarenteed to be running when games are scheduled, players may connect to the server for testing whenever they like.
Games are held every week on Tuesday at 20:00 UTC and on Saturday at 22:00 UTC. Note that those times are in UTC.
Because the server is only for LFS users, and Ian would like to avoid setting a password, the server name is recorded only in the lfs-chat archives.
If you've created an entry for the server in your "favorites" but it's not showing up, you may have "Show empty servers" turned off.
